name: df-co
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1
body: |- wceq(ccom(c0, c1), copab(s0, s1, wex(s2, wa(wbr(cv(s0), c1, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), c0, cv(s1))))))
comment: Define the composition of two classes. Definition 6.6(3) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 24. For example, ` ( ( exp o. cos ) `` 0 ) = _e ` ( ~ ex-co ) because ` ( cos `` 0 ) = 1 ` (see ~ cos0 ) and ` ( exp `` 1 ) = _e ` (see ~ df-e ). Note that Definition 7 of [Suppes] p. 63 reverses ` A ` and ` B ` , uses ` /. ` instead of ` o. ` , and calls the operation "relative product." (Contributed by NM, 4-Jul-1994.)
